111.65.text: or perhaps even many years ago?

115.73.text:
Do you even remember whether
or not you had one?

120.47.text:
Our universe has been
steadily expanding

123.82.text: ever since the big bang explosion

132.62.text:
We are growing further away from
our neighbouring galaxies all the time,

138.52.text:
and the distances between all
the planetary objects are increasing

145.87.text: as far as we can estimate or know.

149.77.text:
So then, what does a kiss from a mother
to her child mean in terms of light years?

159.05.text:
Scientists tell us that our planet
Earth is about 4.5 billion years old,

165.05.text:
that the Earth's moon is at
a distance of about 238,855 miles,

176.66.text: and that this distance is increasing

179.22.text:
as the moon is retreating from
the Earth at a rate of 1.5 inches or 4 cm,

188.40.text: We have learned all these things in school

191.44.text: and used this information almost every day

194.29.text: to understand the world we live in,

198.95.text: or the opera houses, or the roads,

202.21.text: or the houses we live in,

209.09.text: We can perceive the 1.5 inches, or 4 cm,

213.70.text:
and know that it is more
or less the size of our little finger.

218.45.text: But how long does it take to get there

221.76.text: and how much is half a million kilometers?

226.67.text:
How many feet or kilometers would take us
from where we are now to another galaxy

232.25.text: which might have another life form,

234.99.text: or to our ancestors in the past,

238.15.text: or to ourselves in the future...

242.52.text:
What about parallel universes
or any other kind of place or time?

249.17.text: How much of it might we perceive

252.02.text: and what would be our thoughts...

254.58.text:
...if we could see everything
from where we are,

272.15.text:
Battles, wars, the Diesel Engine,
the Millau Viaduct.

278.61.text: As far as we follow, we are born, we eat,

283.19.text: we sleep and inevitably, sooner or later,

289.48.text:
Some say your memory is altered
only after an event happens for real.

295.61.text: Some say it's like a dream,

298.29.text: and remembering yesterday is like a picture.

302.23.text:
Some talk about electrical signals,
or just signs of other kinds of signals...

314.40.text:
or anything else cannot explain
what was or is really happening

319.47.text: and what is really "real", for everyone...

323.06.text:
…when there is relativity in time,
or whatever we call it,

327.49.text:
such perceived differences and
comments are there for almost everything...

333.85.text: …even when we don't know why we sleep

337.11.text:
and our only logical answer is
"because we feel sleepy"

341.77.text:
and for some,
the whole of life is over like a flash,

347.00.text: in the blink of an eye.

349.30.text:
How can one know and
understand all this reality?

355.41.text: If there are rules for being good,

358.53.text:
how can you follow them
if nothing can be measured

361.75.text:
or anything in fact,
really matters in this big mass?

367.96.text: So how do you measure a kiss?

373.69.text: We hunted, we ate, we slept.

378.38.text: The Sun went up and then it went down.

385.99.text:
It seems we don't count all the possible
big or small bangs in between,

391.87.text:
and everything related
in size to the black holes.

397.37.text: It was all in a way quiet,

402.10.text: for several billion years on our planet.

410.47.text:
and if you cannot find an answer
- you, yourself have to answer it.

418.20.text:
does your conscious mind interfere
with your memories subconsciously?

425.13.text: How can you know, or follow?

429.24.text:
How can we measure,
understand, know, or decide,

437.94.text:
what is all of this, what does it all
mean and what really matters

443.22.text: when there is so much unknown?

447.36.text:
Better to say that there is a God and
make him responsible for everything,

452.33.text: from creation to unfairness, to balance,

455.71.text: to the minerals, the water and the fish.

460.79.text:
You might have heard the joke,
about the question from God when we die,

470.89.text: and it's about what we see,

472.87.text: hear, feel, think, assume, know and believe

484.08.text: the Egyptians, the Kings of Akkad,

493.23.text:
Hyskos, Harappan, the Hittites,
the Nubians, the Greeks, the Pharaohs

499.97.text:
- what do you remember
from your childhood?

503.86.text:
When did we put a man in a rocket
and send him into space?

518.42.text:
tamed horses,
developed a phonetic alphabet,

526.76.text: In just a few thousand years.

529.61.text: We built cities, states, then dynasties...

534.13.text: ...and then they fought against one another.

543.09.text:
Iron was used for
the very first time in Austria...

547.22.text:
The Greeks, the Romans,
the Celts or Ottomans.

570.66.text: got sick, got well, we died, were born,

598.22.text:
Etruria, King David,
King Solomon, the Vannic Kingdom,

603.38.text: Carthage, Rome, the fall of Samaria…

611.18.text:
The Japanese Empire, Sparta,
the Assyrian destruction of Babylon,

633.99.text: of Issus, of Gaugamela, and of Ipsus…

647.49.text:
Archimedes,
the Great Wall of China,

658.74.text:
Herod, Hsin Han, Caligula, Nero, Kushan,
Marcus Aurelius, Septimius Severus…

676.06.text:
Tatar warriors breaking
through the Great Wall,

685.64.text:
the Battle of Mursa,
the Battle of Argentoratum,

704.61.text:
Between 1.8 billion
and 800 million years ago,

709.63.text: the fossil record looks so dull.

712.74.text:
So much so that the period
is called the "Boring Billion":

721.44.text:
or 1 day, not a year, not 10,
not a 100, a 1000, or even a million:

728.75.text: 1 billion years of boredom and silence.

739.11.text:
We haven't witnessed
the birth of the Earth.

742.60.text: We have theories, theses, books, research,

746.99.text:
many things to say, almost for everything,
from the beginning of time,

751.33.text:
the big bang, creation, design,
the origin of life, evolution,

760.77.text:
plate tectonics,
from one cell to Cambrian explosion,

765.86.text:
from the fish walking on to land,
to mammals, primates,

770.00.text:
the extinction of the dinosaurs,
to photosynthesis.

780.42.text:
We have been in existence
for only a fifth of a million years.

786.32.text:
During that time, we have spread
from our place of origin in Africa

790.53.text:
to inhabit every continent,
and to reach even outer space.

796.55.text:
Our reckless and careless activities
have already caused the extinction

800.79.text: of many species of animals and birds,

803.99.text:
and brought about a major
and rapid climate change on Earth.

809.50.text: Africa, the Middle East, Asia, Europe,

813.59.text:
North America, South America,
Japan, China, the Ottomans,

823.54.text:
Technology, Nobel Prizes,
the Oscars, Sports, Championships,

829.39.text: Battles, Wars, World Wars, and more Wars.

834.58.text:
All that has happened in
the recorded period of history

838.73.text:
has taken place during a very small
fraction of our planet's existence.

845.06.text:
Yet, we cannot remember everything
exactly from our childhood days,

849.52.text: or nights, or even from yesterday.

856.09.text: If we only perceive all of this,

859.60.text:
we still don't understand
the concept of time

870.10.text: We say this happened in that year,

875.62.text:
We have perhaps 70-80 years
in this world as our lifetime.

883.67.text: what will you remember from today?

887.12.text: How and what do we know about

889.58.text:
or how could we measure the years,
months, weeks or days

897.40.text: and there was no night or day?

902.28.text:
The education system we use today
was mainly shaped after the 18th century

908.17.text:
and we started to award ourselves
degrees in order to get jobs,

915.86.text: Daily lives and lives in general,

920.13.text: our time shaped before we were born.

925.11.text: what could and should be the proper work for us,

928.63.text: why we work and what we work for,

934.52.text: Most of us are born into it,

944.22.text: the things we think and believe in;

947.04.text:
it was already shaped and is being
shaped every day by others,

963.14.text: A more digital, a more diverse spread,

968.24.text: From slapping each other's backs as apes,

971.48.text:
to tagging each other
digitally on social networks.

978.64.text: What would a child matter to its father?

983.57.text:
The advanced scientific
and technological revolution

987.39.text:
which started in the 1950s with
the creation of computers,

991.64.text: and after the 1990s with the internet,

994.76.text:
and at the start of the new millennium,
with social networks and smart phones;

1000.29.text:
all these things started
the internet of things

1005.02.text: and they all made the revolution faster.

1008.58.text:
Some said we'd become chipped,
counted and categorized

1026.16.text:
that even with
the support of new inventions,

1029.43.text: all that is happening on earth,

1031.87.text:
all the "processes"
become harder to follow

1036.08.text: and events become difficult to catch,

1061.57.text: all went like a snow flake to a snowball

1070.22.text: The gap between rich and poor,

1078.52.text:
and perceptions, paradigms,
change in waves,

1093.94.text:
turning and twisting,
small scale and big scale,

1098.28.text:
never heard of, fake or real,
all published wars,

1103.19.text:
media, news, icons, follows,
unfollows, likes,

1108.53.text:
who cured the diseases,
who started them already,

1111.59.text:
who became big, who travelled far,
who came back.

1115.35.text:
We created everything, and we couldn't
follow them, ourselves. All, us…

1121.88.text:
It didn't matter how far
the moon was anymore.

1131.87.text: alien abduction, nuclear wars or oil spills,

1136.62.text:
bar codes, bigger businesses,
tsunamis, charismatic leaders,

1142.04.text: wars - big and small, and more,

1145.00.text:
great or small walls between countries or
people or the police or the mother and child,

1151.55.text:
politics, power groups,
conspiracy theorists, free masons,

1156.00.text:
Brazil, Canada, Illuminati, Nosferatu,
Paganini, nothing really mattered.

1164.44.text:
Did that really matter
while it was already working…

1173.89.text:
or assume, or estimate,
or the questions and answers about us,

1179.28.text:
all that mattered some
"estimated" years ago,

1197.51.text:
After a while,
we didn't know what was born

1209.72.text:
We had days and nights,
so long, so quick.

1215.21.text:
On one of those days, we woke up into a world
that is more industrialized than ever,

1222.88.text:
more advanced,
more categorized for everything,

1240.21.text: and then the petroleum sources ran out,

1243.93.text:
and we stopped playing with currencies,
and found new sources,

1258.83.text: and then we consumed all of that too.

1262.47.text: We made the meat, designed the sleep.

1270.52.text:
failed, won, ceased, ended,
started, did their duties,

1275.43.text: and became another part of history,

1283.44.text: people to people, one nation to another.

1291.01.text: Expansion went on, like it always did.

1295.54.text:
Some people went under the surface,
built their lives there,

1300.15.text: some went up to the skies,

1305.44.text: Some genes survived in this way,

1314.03.text: by some other parts of us,

1320.94.text: We, in general, in time and place,

1334.54.text: If you believed in some God,

1337.09.text:
he tried to continue making
new souls for the new bodies,

1341.17.text: who could witness what is left...

1347.72.text: Did we wage wars on poverty,

1359.09.text:
Do you believe there was
and still is a God,

1362.30.text:
when things happen,
to regulate everything

1365.68.text:
or just to watch and hope
that good will always win?

1371.94.text:
If people could still be born,
not produced,

1376.57.text: and we had light already in our eyes,

1380.88.text:
if we could be sure about
the black forests,

1384.73.text: if the trees were free to grow naturally,

1387.85.text:
and if the crows were still free
to fly in their instinctive ways,

1392.43.text:
and if what flowed in
the rivers was still pure water...

1399.22.text:
...could we know and measure
how blue is a blue sky

1404.55.text:
and what it means for
an army to be ready for war,

1408.09.text: waiting for the signal to attack,

1410.98.text: a bright, sunny day in all human history?

1416.66.text:
How would you define religion,
war, economics,

1426.70.text:
if you were produced
without a mother or a father,

1430.44.text:
and born into a motherless surface,
without light,

1438.25.text: and if all these shaped before you,

1442.44.text:
how could you measure,
before knowing humanity

1453.32.text:
How would you know what is happening
between a mother's kiss

1457.98.text: and what part of you would stay with it
